SENT.plain: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE: Acute basilar artery occlusion portends high risk of stroke and death
Thrombolysis or endovascular therapy has been limited to patients who present within hours of symptom onset
Without recanalization, acute basilar artery occlusion almost always results in death or severe disability
SUMMARY OF CASE: We report a case of basilar artery occlusion and successful endovascular recanalization 80 days after symptom onset
CONCLUSIONS: Endovascular therapy can be feasible and safe for symptomatic basilar artery occlusion at chronic stage
